zone.line: showers
A thing of mans art chaged by
A nursling of man art abandoned by
immortal
his care & changed by Nature into the
likeness of her own creations, & destined
to partake thier immortality. Behold
hemisphered hemisphered
a majestic vision. It is changed into
into
a mountain cloven by time into woody
dells: and shattered into overhanging precipices,
and the clouds intercepted by its summit
with their rain.
feed its eternal fountains By the column
on which we sit I should judge that it had
once been crowned by a temple or a theatre
& that on sacred days, the radiant multitude
with basket for the sacrifice
wound up its craggy path. It was such
itself ——- Helen what sound of
wings is that?
young
It is the wild pigeons returning to their nests;
do you not hear the murmur of those who
are in their nests?
